result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark R Repka was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
To be paid at rate of $50.00 per month commencing July 1, 2015 or penalty of 10 days Huber for non-payment.
DNA Surcharge waived.
DNA Sample waived.

Court grants expunction after 1 year upon written request of the defendant and upon proof of full-time employment/school, finishing treatment at QuadMed, and continuing to test negative for marijuana.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark R Repka

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: regarding treatment
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Mark R Repka in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 2.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 1 dismissed and read in.

Court orders the following: 
- Fine totaling: $505.00 to be paid at rate of $50.00 per month commencing July 1, 2015; alternate 10 days Huber
- DNA Surcharge waived
- DNA Sample waived
- Court grants expunction after 1 year upon written request of the defendant and upon proof of full-time employment/school, finishing treatment at QuadMed, and continuing to test negative for marijuana.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 29, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Mark R Repka in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests adjournment to allow defendant to complete substantial treatment.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Mark R Repka in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is requesting a plea and sentencing date in about 60 days for the defendant to complete treatment.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Filed by the State.
Jury trial - 12 person on January 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on January 8, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Mark R Repka in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense has been provided with discovery and requests a trial date.  Jury status hearing scheduled for January 8, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for January 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary Hearing requested  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 29, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.
